alert.note: Alert for Halifax; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 10:26PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Pittsylvania and southwestern Halifax Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1025 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near near Chatham, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall could result in flooding. Locations impacted include... Chatham... Ingram... Elmo... Java... Dry Fork... and Keeling. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
